meanings.sent1: The company's CEO was titularly in charge, but the real decisions were made by the board.
meanings.sent2: She was titularly the team captain, but everyone knew she lacked leadership skills.
meanings.sent3: The cat, titularly named 'Fluffy', was actually quite aggressive towards strangers.
meanings.sent4: The old house, titularly a mansion, was now in a state of disrepair and neglect.
meanings.sent5: The king, titularly the ruler of the land, had no real power and was merely a figurehead.

meanings.definition: As the title character or holder of a title
meanings.sent1: In the play, she portrayed the titularly of the princess, bringing grace and elegance to the role.
meanings.sent2: He was excited to watch the movie featuring his favorite titularly, a brave knight on a quest.
meanings.sent3: The dog, titularly 'Rex', was the star of the show with his impressive tricks.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece depicted the titularly of a famous historical figure in stunning detail.
meanings.sent5: The book's cover showcased the titularly, a mysterious detective, in a shadowy alleyway.
